intro: Hypolytrum jenmanii subsp. serratifolium, commonly known as the serrated-leaf hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
